title: Tallest Mountain
fact: Mount Everest, at 8,848 meters (29,029 feet) above sea level, is the tallest mountain on Earth.

title: Deepest Ocean Trench
fact: The Mariana Trench is the deepest part of the world's oceans, reaching a depth of about 11 kilometers (7 miles).

title: Largest Desert
fact: The Sahara Desert in Africa is the largest hot desert in the world, spanning approximately 9.2 million square kilometers (3.6 million square miles).

title: Earth's Age
fact: Earth is estimated to be about 4.54 billion years old.

title: Largest Ocean
fact: The Pacific Ocean is the largest ocean on Earth, covering more than 63 million square miles.

title: Earth's Atmosphere
fact: Earth's atmosphere is composed of 78% nitrogen, 21% oxygen, and trace amounts of other gases.

title: Rotation and Revolution
fact: Earth takes approximately 24 hours to complete one rotation on its axis and about 365.25 days to orbit the Sun.

title: Earth's Magnetic Field
fact: Earth's magnetic field protects the planet from solar wind and cosmic radiation.

title: Water Coverage
fact: About 71% of Earth's surface is covered by water, with the majority being saltwater in the oceans.

title: Diverse Ecosystems
fact: Earth hosts a variety of ecosystems, including forests, deserts, grasslands, and aquatic environments.
